page.title: 12Extractive Industry-Economy
page.content: The gravel pit was first quarried in l935 by the owner's grandfather and is roughly half-way through its productive life. It covers an area of 120 acres including 12 buildings which are used for offices and maintenance workshops where 55 workers are employed.The pit is 105 acres and as each hole is worked out it is then filled in with waste and reclaimed for agriculture. The washing process is done in a closed system but any extra water needed is taken from (nearby) Whitemere. Of the 3 grades of sand deposited in this process grade 1 is particularly suitable for hospital floor screed and airport runways where maximum vibrations occur as the planes take off.
